reviews.review: FPS with puzzle solving adventure. Kinda like an escape room, but you get to kill creepy crawlies and shoot stuff. Annoyingly hard at times, but hey, that's the point isn't it!?

Half-Life 2 has a good story with no plot holes that I could find, and it has good character no matter if they're in the good side or the bad side. The only problem or issue I could find is when the flashlight uses the same battery as your suit, or when the vehicles fell either uncontrollable or hit everything that feels that it shouldn't hit. If you're a player who want to get every achievement it is possible and people can still do it in less than a day but just know you're going to go back a lot of times.

Half-Life 2.. this game will be remembered for a long time, so where to start, probably because the version of Half-life 2 that is now, is another game, and the initial version of the game was to come out at the end in 2003, but because of the German hacker Axel's Gembe, who hacked the Valve server and posted the source code on the network, received 2 years in prison on probation, forcing the development team to quickly redo everything (characters, lore, etc.).
So, let's start a review of this game and find out if the game is relevant in 2021?
-Visual part:
And by today's standards, the graphics in Half-Life 2 still remain quite good, and even some newer games still can not compete with it in photorealism, and imagine what it was in 2004 (even against the background of games that were released then, and they were : GTA: SA, FarCry, NFS: Underground 2 and others)? And all this with the help of its own Source engine, which is almost perfectly optimized and with it you can make unsurpassedly beautiful games.
The only downside - the range of drawing, and then this disadvantage is manifested only in open spaces (for example, in the section "Water barrier").
And of the pros - Fantastic work with lighting, fire here in my opinion is the best of all the games in which I played and water is the same as fire.
-Physics, gameplay and mechanics:
Probably these are the most important aspects in this game, because there are physical puzzles (compared to the first part, but they became too obvious in the passage), also if we touched the first part I want to say that compared to the first part of the second became much easier to pass (I understood that they wanted to compensate with the number of enemies, but it didn't work out).
About the mechanics of shooting, it is average by today's standards .. probably even below average (of course, compared to the first part of the shooting has improved). The most infuriating - random scatter and a little less - the accuracy of the sight.
But Half-Life wouldn't be Half-Life if it didn't have a gravity gun, so think for yourself, if Half-Life didn't have a gravity gun, what kind of game would it be? In my opinion, Half-Life would be a simple first-person shooter, because with the help of a gravity gun you can take dozens or even hundreds of funny screenshots (as in my case)), and seriously, with the help of a gravity gun Half -Life shows itself not as a first-person shooter with puzzles, but you can even say a full-fledged sandbox (if you play, you will understand what "sandbox" I'm talking about).
Physics in Half-Life 2 do not be afraid to say the standard of all games, for example: you can break a box and every part of this box that you see - you can move, you can also move every weapon and if you break the glass, the glass will break only in the place where you hit him and parting completely with cracks.
-Conclusion:
So! The game is also relevant for 2021, because where else can you find a game that has mixed levels with different elements: horror, puzzles, etc., with a good atmosphere, physics, soundtrack (from Kelly Bailey) and good graphics?

Shooting mechanics can feel a little outdated today, but it still holds up well as a fun trip with some pretty memorable locations and moments. Definitely worth getting on sale even if you're a zoomer.
A fantastic game and everyone should play it.]

[h1][b]One of the Best Games I've Ever Played[/b][/h1]
Half-Life 2 is an [b]AMAZING[/b] sequel to the first game. Valve expanded from the original Half-Life with a much deeper, well written story, and NPC's with more depth and character. The new mechanics and weapons were very well implemented as well, one of my favorites being the pulse rifle. The story was pretty linear but there was a couple of plot twists that were introduced and carried out very well. Overall, an amazing sequel to a fantastic franchise and I am excited to play episode one and two.
"The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world"
Great story, nice music, made in the engine that's easier to abuse than my wife. Conclusion = AMAZING JUST AMAZING!

This is widley regarded as one of the greatest videogames of all time, and I can say it lives up to that. I'm not sure if I enjoyed this or Black Mesa (HL1) more. This is a must own game but only after youve played HL1 first
